elements.name: panel1
elements.title: Luc, 30, and Laura, 28, are in love and have been a couple for a year. They want to move in together and maybe have children later. Laura works 100% as a nursing specialist HF. Her annual income is CHF 92,000. Luc also works 100% as a landscape gardener and his annual income is CHF 68,000. Because Luc is very handy and a good cook, the couple agree that he will do most of the housework (shopping, cooking, washing, etc.). He will therefore reduce his workload to 80%. They want to do the cleaning together. Both are realistic and know that many relationships don't last a lifetime. It is therefore important to them that any separation would be very fair.

elements.name: question3
elements.title: Marriage, cohabitation with or without a cohabitation agreement? First decide roughly which of these 3 forms of cohabitation seems most suitable for Luc and Laura by using the decision tree "Marriage or cohabitation". Use the decision tree to briefly and precisely explain your decision.
elements.correctAnswer: Luc will do a lot of the housework. He also earns considerably less than Laura. A cohabitation agreement would therefore be recommended at the very least.

elements.name: question1
elements.title: With your decision above, you have excluded 2 forms of cohabitation. For one of the excluded forms, explain why it seems less advantageous to you. To do this, refer to a key element (children, death, divorce/separation, etc.) from the "Marriage or cohabitation" comparison table.
elements.correctAnswer:
Cohabitation without a contract: Luc has reduced his workload and thus his income/asset accumulation because he runs the couple's household almost alone. Without a cohabitation agreement, Luc would be at a significant disadvantage in the event of a separation. The cohabitation agreement could, for example, stipulate that Laura bears the joint household costs alone in order to indirectly compensate Luc for his housework.
Marriage: If Luc and Laura get married, this will probably result in a tax "marriage penalty".
